name.namePart: Printed with the assistance of Dr. Olan Nance

mods.abstract: Abstract design suggestive of the tracery of a window or perhaps a spider's web.
mods.note: This print ranks among the earliest of the electron prints done by Ms. Durieux. Therefore, it is of an experimental nature. Ms. Durieux related that only a few prints were in this edition as she was experimenting to see if a color electron print was possible. The print is made from a single matrix with a thick emulsion film. It was printed in three colors: light red, yellow, and purplish-grey. The light red areas were created using a brush dipped in the radioactive dye and literally applied to the matrix.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
